metadata.synopsis: Romance fate with Lae'zel. Only occurs if Lae'zel has chosen to stay in Faerun.1. Because player convinced Orpheus path Lae'zel to stay even after sacrificing orpheus.2. Because player convinced her to stay on Faerun.Otherwise she has left to fight for Orpheus / ascend to Vlaakith.

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: By any account, I should have slit you open from scalp to stomach and watched you drain.

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: By any account, I should have slit you open from scalp to stomach and watched you drain.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: You made me betray Orpheus, son of Gith, prince of the githyanki.

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: But you are zhak vo'n'fynh duj. First, you inflict my wounds. Then with burning breath, you close them.
25.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: Last night will be forever branded into my memory -
47.context: InternalNodeContext: SH subnodes for shar/anti-shar path

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: - but now I must think of future days.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: SH subnodes for shar/anti-shar path

124.speaker: Lae'zel
124.text: I am forever marked by Vlaakith. The Undying Queen's knights will chase me across Faerûn 'til I draw my final breath.
124.context: InternalNodeContext: SH subnodes for shar/anti-shar path

29.speaker: Lae'zel
29.text: Our lives will be coloured by blood-red and death-black. Are you ready for the battles to come?
29.context: InternalNodeContext: SH subnodes for shar/anti-shar path

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: I wouldn't want it any other way. We're together now - in as much as Lady Shar allows.
95.context: InternalNodeContext: SH subnodes for shar/anti-shar path

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I wouldn't want it any other way. We're together now.
7.context: InternalNodeContext: SH subnodes for shar/anti-shar path

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: Yes. A bond so tight, Vlaakith would unleash the Astral Sea's fury if she every tried to break it.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: When the red dragons come, we will shake the skies with their screams. The ground will be soaked and spoiled wherever the kith'raki fall.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Let Vlaakith's forces come. I will send them to their graves.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: Yes! The skies will shake from the red dragon's screams. The ground will be soaked and spoiled wherever the kith'raki fall.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: We will not be their prey. They will be ours!

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: Our days will be many, our bond ever stronger, as long as we hew together.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Come. Let's make this day count - and all the ones to follow.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: Hells - talk of battle's set my heart beating all over again.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: Back to bed. I have more tricks to show you...

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I'm sorry, but that's not the life I want. This is where our paths diverge.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: What kind of life might that be, in this ghaik form you now suffer?

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: Bah - what does it matter? You implored me to stay with you, only to reject me.

34.speaker: Lae'zel
34.text: You implore me to stay with you, only to reject me? Chk. To think I cared for such a coward.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Forget it. You're on your own.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: A thousand wounds inflicted, and you couldn't resist opening this last one.

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: So strong was our bond, the Astral Sea rippled in concord.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: So strong is the bond's breaking, that it now shakes in turmoil.

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: Good-bye. My first love and my last.

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: My life will be coloured by blood-red and death-black. I face many battles to come. And I would ask you to join me.

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: You would stay with me, even though I look like... this?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: You would stay with me, even though I look like... this?

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Quite simply: yes. I was stained by Vlaakith's lies. Without you, I'd never have been cleansed of them.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: Just - give me time to get used to the tentacles. And the head. But mostly the tentacles.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Of course. Together, we'll face the coming onslaught.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: If it means a chance to know you even better, I'm all in.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Rain death on your enemies and blood-wine on our flesh, and there is every chance.

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Our days will be many, our bond ever stronger, as long as we hew together.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Come. Let's make this day count - and all the ones to follow.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: Orpheus has fallen. My life will be coloured by blood-red and death-black. I must prepare for the battles to come.
48.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: Allow me to aid you. Lady Shar will understand, so long as your enemies can be deemed hers also.
58.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Let me come with you. We can defeat Vlaakith's forces together.
52.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: You'll get lonely. Maybe you'd like some company on your journey.
113.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I am sure you'll make the best of it. But you'll do it without me.
118.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Good luck, but you're on your own.
105.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: Chk. Did you think I'd ask you to join me?
96.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

132.speaker: Lae'zel
132.text: You let perish the Prince of the Comet, the True Heir of my people.
132.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.text: That you wear the guise of a ghaik, I might have overlooked. That you stole Orpheus from his people? I could never.
8.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: This is good-bye. Not because I don't care for you - but because I do.

121.speaker: Lae'zel
121.text: You are the source of my wounds. I will forever remember, and forever bleed.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: An unforgiveable slight, to me - and to our bond.
68.context: NodeContext: A break up but not too harsh, still with fondness.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: My life will be coloured by blood-red and death-black. I must prepare for the battles to come.
38.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: Let me come with you. We can defeat Vlaakith's forces together.
64.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Let me come with you. We can defeat Vlaakith's forces together.
73.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

123.speaker: Lae'zel
123.text: You look like ghaik - and even so, I might have said yes, had you further indulged my needs in the city.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: I might have said yes, if you'd further indulged our obsessions.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: You'll get lonely. Maybe you'd like some company on your journey.
117.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: Instead, you tasted me, tested me - and turned away when you'd had your fill.
5.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: You inflicted my wounds, and I inflicted yours. Some will stop hurting. But all of them will leave lasting marks.
69.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

92.speaker: Lae'zel
92.text: Goodbye, zhak vo'n'fynh duj. You will not be forgotten.
92.context: NodeContext: ZHACK VOHN-fin DOO - source of my bruises

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I am sure you'll make the best of it. But you'll do it without me.

101.speaker: Lae'zel
101.text: As I expected. You indulged an obsession - you tasted me, tested me, and had your fill.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Good luck, but you're on your own.

103.speaker: Lae'zel
103.text: Of course I am. You indulged an obsession - you tasted me, tested me, and had your fill.

17.speaker: Lae'zel
17.text: Lae'zel. My engine... it's... it's finally burning me through.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Lae'zel. My engine... it's... it's finally burning me through.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: Kaincha! No. Your journey does not end here.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Try to reply. Try to contain the inferno inside you.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: Tsk'va! You are pallid. Your engine - it will soon break down completely if we don't act.

67.speaker: Lae'zel
67.text: You are the saviour of the Sword Coast. You are the murderer of death itself. You are the source of my joy.

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: We are returning to Avernus. You will be well, and I will be by your side. Together, we will face the Hells, and Vlaakith besides, should she pursue us there. And we will thrive.

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: We are returning to Avernus. You will be well, and I will be by your side. Together, we will face the Hells. And we will thrive.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I can't let you do that, Lae'zel. Avernus is too horrible.

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: I would relish the opportunity to test my mettle upon the devils of Avernus.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: It is Zariel who should tremble - not us.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: If you really mean it, I'll go back with you.

97.speaker: Lae'zel
97.text: Your sense is intact. Good. Let us go - before it's too late.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: No, Lae'zel. I swore I'd never go back, and I meant it. All I want now is to see the sky one more time.

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: Then a warrior's death it is. Come. I will stay by your side until the very last moment - source of my bruises.

126.speaker: Lae'zel
126.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. I'm sticky with sweat and the distant planes know what else.

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: First, you inflict my wounds. Then with burning breath, you close them. I have lost the thread between pain and pleasure.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Orpheus is dead - yet Vlaakith still marks me as traitor and prey.

6.speaker: Lae'zel
6.text: Vlaakith's turned her back to me, and I to her. I am forever marked.

13.speaker: Lae'zel
13.text: The Undying Queen's knights will chase me across Faerûn 'til I draw my final breath.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: An illithid stands before me. My eyes show me a horror; my heart sees something more.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: An illithid stands before me. My eyes show me a horror; my heart sees something more.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: I see the conqueror who defeated the Netherbrain and ended its Grand Design.

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: I see the generous spirit who sacrificed everything so my people could be free.

16.speaker: Lae'zel
16.text: I know who lives behind this ghaik disguise: the source of my bruises and the source of my joy -

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: - and the one with whom I'd spend my future days.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: I see the conqueror who defeated the Netherbrain and ended its Grand Design.

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.text: But I also see the wretch who made me betray Orpheus, son of Gith, prince of the githyanki.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: It's not your form that appals me. It's your contempt.

119.speaker: Lae'zel
119.text: Now I must turn my thoughts to future days.

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I see the conqueror who defeated the Netherbrain and ended its Grand Design.

108.speaker: Lae'zel
108.text: And I see the source of my bruises. The one who earned my obsession and became my possession.

11.speaker: Lae'zel
11.text: But that was the past. I must turn my attention to future days.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: I abandoned my prince for you - and for a path of our making, away from the Astral.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: And yet I breathe all the more free. Little is lost, so much is gained.
